definition: to guarantee replacement (of faulty goods)/warranty
surname Bao
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic

sentences.english: All our goods are guaranteed for one year.
sentences.chinese: 我們所有的商品一年內均包換。

sentences.english: Mr Grey bought his camera on approval.
sentences.chinese: 格雷先生買這架照相機，包退包換。

sentences.english: Quality assurance, shifting Baotui three months, so your peace of mind with.
sentences.chinese: 品質保證，三個月包換包退，讓你用的安心。

sentences.english: He bartered his handbag for a mobile phone.
sentences.chinese: 他用手提包換了一部手機。

sentences.english: One-month replacement, a one-year warranty and lifetime maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 一個月包換，一年保修，終身維護。

sentences.english: She is really an English woman.
sentences.chinese: 她是如假包換的英國女性。

sentences.english: We have the goods on appro for a week.
sentences.chinese: 我們這些貨品一星期內包退包換。

sentences.english: We promise replacement within 6 months if any quality problems are found.
sentences.chinese: 如有質量問題，六個月內可包退包換。

sentences.english: Replaceable within three months from the date of sale.
sentences.chinese: 出售之日起三個月內包換。
這些都是如假包換的汽車，他說。

sentences.english: He bought the television set on approval.
sentences.chinese: 他購買了一臺包退包換的電視機。

definition: to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
to repair a tire
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
to return something to its rightful owner
see 掉包[diao4 bao1]
IOU/informal document acknowledging a debt
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
statement of account
sick personnel/person on the sick list/patient
psychiatric hospital
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
